body:
I CLICKED ON THE LINK JOZZ GAVE ME ON SKYPE I JUST READ A THREAD BY A STAFF SAYING TO NOT CLICK! WHAT DO I DO PLEASE HELP ME!!!

Update:
I just read the comments, I'm removing my computer from Quarentene as I havent registered on the false website because the link havent worked BUT I registered in the offcial [server name] website, am I in risk?

title: RED ALERT!!!PLEASE HELP ME!!!!

replies.body:
If you have clicked on the link, you'll be fine. If you logged in the your credentials, then change your MC password ASAP.

My Skype was hacked, so it wasn't me who sent it (FYI).
replies.body_tagged:
If you have clicked on the link, you'll be fine. If you logged in the your credentials, then change your MC password ASAP.

My Skype was hacked, so it wasn't me who sent it (FYI).

replies.body:
Don't get your nickers in a knot..
It wont do anything if you click the link, just don't enter your Minecraft account and everything will be okay.. k?
replies.body_tagged:
Don't get your nickers in a knot..
It wont do anything if you click the link, just don't enter your Minecraft account and everything will be okay.. k?

replies.body:
I did the same as you, but nothing will happen to you.
Unless you click on "register" on that website, nothing will happen. If you did click on "register" and you made an account, then you should change your Minecraft password right now.
It is support to give you some type of keylogger, if you do log in, but if you simply clicked on the link, you have nothing to worry about.

However, you should change your password nonetheless, just for safety measures, although nothing is supposed to happen to you.
replies.body_tagged:
I did the same as you, but nothing will happen to you.
Unless you click on "register" on that website, nothing will happen. If you did click on "register" and you made an account, then you should change your Minecraft password right now.
It is support to give you some type of keylogger, if you do log in, but if you simply clicked on the link, you have nothing to worry about.

However, you should change your password nonetheless, just for safety measures, although nothing is supposed to happen to you.

I came here because I thought this was about Avicade ;-;

Anyway I would just change scan your computer incase you got a keylogger to be safe. And if you did enter your account info, go to a different computer/device to change it, incase you DID get a keylogger.
